title: Ronaldo 'like a 12th player' during Euro 2016 final – Portugal boss Santos
text:
0 09-Jan-2017 13:10:09 The forward was famously taken off injured against France but rallied his team-mates from the touchline as they secured their first major trophy 
Portugal coach Fernando Santos has paid tribute to Cristiano Ronaldo for acting like a 12th player during his side's Euro 2016 final win. 
Neymar & Pogba OUT of FIFA World 11 
Ronaldo came off after just 25 minutes of the decider in July last year due to a knee injury, but his side managed to edge France 1-0 after extra time. 
The Real Madrid star, along with his coach, was vocal from the sidelines as Eder proved the match-winner for A Seleção. 
And Santos has praised Ronaldo for his role in helping Portugal secure a first major trophy. 
Barcelona leave Liga title in Real Madrid's hands 
"Cristiano played part of the final. Second, his presence on the field, after he went off injured, it was like having a 12th player," he told Corriere della Sera . 
Ronaldo was criticised for his actions during the final, with some suggesting he was trying to act like the coach ahead of Santos. 
However, Santos has since dismissed the criticism, saying Ronaldo deserves to be lauded for trying to inspire his team. 
"Joining with your heart to the fate of the team is always a strength, never a fault," he added. Related
